alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nitrides

class.description: Inorganic compounds belonging to either the halogen hydrides, halogen nitrides, halogen oxides, or halogen sulfides.
class.name: Halogen organides

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as halogen nitrides. These are inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it is a halogen.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it is a halogen.
direct_parent.name: Halogen nitrides

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

subclass.description: Inorganic compounds of nitrogen where nitrogen has a formal oxidation state of -3, and the heaviest atom bonded to it is a halogen.
subclass.name: Halogen nitrides

superclass.description: Inorganic compounds that contain only metal elements.
superclass.name: Homogeneous non-metal compounds
